titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Kiev Foundation pamphlet collection, 1898-1979 K0004
titlestmt.author: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-01-11 11:31:16 -0500.

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.unittitle: Kiev Foundation Pamphlet Collection
did.abstract: The majority of the pamphlets concern antisemitism and sermons from prominent European and American rabbis. The pamphlets are dated from 1946-79.

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: Kiev Foundation pamphlet collection, Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The pamphlet collection consists of purchases made after the original donation of the I. Edward Kiev Judaica Collection in 1996 and are primarily gifts from the Kiev Family Trust, with some materials donated by Dr. Samuel Halperin.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The pamphlet collection consists of purchases made after the original donation of the I. Edward Kiev Judaica Collection in 1996 and are primarily gifts from the Kiev Foundation, with some materials donated by Dr. Samuel Halperin.
This is an open collection and materials continue to be actively acquired.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of 3 linear feet of pamphlets purchased or donated after the original donation of the I. Edward Kiev Collection. There are about one hundred pamphlets in the series ranging in date from 1925 to 2012. The collection consists primarily of pamphlets concerning anti-Semitism and Holocaust denial, most of which were published by Liberty Bell Publications. There are also eleven issues of the American Standard, a bi-weekly anti-Semitic and anti-Catholic serial. Also included in the series are sermons from prominent European and American rabbis, reports from the Baron de Hirsch Trade School, and a French serial devoted to the Alfred Dreyfus trial of 1894.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Text in English and Hebrew. Budapest : BZSH in co-operation with Optimum Publishing, 1992.

Several undated items found tucked inside this booklet: "Don't Forget the Victims" (pamphlet discussing Budapest memorial to Hungarian Jewish Holocaust victims), "The Chosen Tours" (brochure offering tours of Hungary's Jewish heritage), "Dohny Street Synagogue Interior" (postcard), and "Memorial Martyrs" (postcard).
